item.title: Shōgun Celebrates Golden Globes Sweep With Season 2 Update
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/shogun-season-2-golden-globes-news-1851733290

We all saw it coming. Still, the best show of 2024 gave us a welcome surprise. At last night’s Golden Globe Awards, the FX series Shōgun not only cemented its remarkable year in gold, but also gave all of its fans an update on its upcoming second season to tide us over as we wait to return to feudal Japan.

Suggested Reading

Live Forever in the Universe of 'New World: Aeternum'

Suggested Reading

According to ScreenRant’s reporting from a Golden Globes press conference attended by Shōgun creators Rachel Kondo and Justin Marks, the pair dished on Season 2's development as an ongoing process before Marks revealed, “we’re about six weeks until the end of the writers’ room.” Yes, by the end of February, the next installment in the saga of Lord Yoshii Toranaga (Hiroyuki Sanada) and potentially John Blackthorne (Cosmo Jarvis, who is not yet confirmed to be returning) will likely be written.

This news comes after the show with the most-watched debut week in FX history, won all four of the Golden Globe awards it was nominated for, including Best Television Drama. With that win, it became only the third FX show in the last 20 years to be bestowed such an honor, following the criminally underrated The Americans and Nip/Tuck. Tadanobu Asano’s stellar portrayal of disgraced and deceitful Kashigi Yabushige helped win the network its first-ever Golden Globe in the category of Best Supporting Actor – Series, Miniseries or Television Film. The show’s other wins were Sanada for Actor in a Drama TV Series, and Anna Sawai, who played Lady Mariko, for Actress in a Drama TV Series.

At the end of its first season, which was based on James Clavell’s 1975 novel of the same name, Toranaga had surreptitiously been treating people’s lives like chess pieces, keeping Blackthorne under his control by destroying his ship, and benefiting from Lady Mariko’s heartbreaking death after sending her into the lion’s den of Osaka where his rival Ishido Kazunari (Takehiro Hira) was awaiting his surrender. And he still hasn’t divulged the full extent of his plans, even with a major battle for ruler of Japan possibly on the horizon.

Safe to say that while season one more or less covered the entirety of James Clavell’s novel, there’s more than enough opportunity for the show’s writers to continue the story and create another award-winning year for one of the best shows of the 2020s.

item.title: 13 Years Later, You Can Still Find People Playing Call of Duty On PS Vita
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/black-ops-declassified-ps-vita-playstation-servers-2025-1851733259

The one Call of Duty game released on the PlayStation Vita in 2012 apparently still has an active player base in 2025. So if you’ve been desperately wanting to play Nukehouse again, go find your Vita and Black Ops Declassified and hop online.

Suggested Reading

The Sims 4's Free Infant Update Can't Compare To The Growing Together Expansion

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Call of Duty: Black Ops Declassified was released back in 2012 on Sony’s portable PlayStation Vita console. It wasn’t a huge hit compared to other CoD games, not least because the Vita itself wasn’t a big seller. But despite the Vita being a portable console from over a decade ago and Black Ops: Declassified being a oddball spin-off from 2012, there are still enough people playing the FPS in 2025 that you can reportedly boot up a Vita right now and find a match in seconds.

On January 4, PlayStation content creator Radec posted on Twitter that they were able to boot up a PS Vita and find matches “instantly” in Call of Duty: Black Ops Declassified. The tweet went viral, likely because a lot of people were surprised to hear that Declassified was still popular and being played in 2025. And I bet some people were just shocked to hear about a PS Vita Call of Duty even existing.

Radec isn’t the only person reporting this. In the replies to the tweet you can find other players sharing stories of how they just recently booted up the game on their own PS Vita and also found matches quickly. Another player shared how they found matches quickly in Declassified in November, saying it only took about 20 seconds to find a full lobby.

“Legit. Like last month I connected my Vita to my mobile hotspot and checked Black Ops Declassified multiplayer and there were almost full lobbies with all kinds of players,” said another user in response to Radec’s tweet. “The best part about the whole experience was there were no hackers. Just people who wanna unwind and play.”

Declassified isn’t the only old CoD game still being played in 2025. You can still boot up most Call of Duty games released on PS3, Xbox 360, Xbox One, and PS4 and find players instantly. Some people just don’t want to move on. Be warned though, as someone who has done this, the people still playing these older Call of Duty games are veterans who know the maps and weapons incredibly well and you’ll likely get stomped over and over.

item.title: These Are Marvel Rivals' Best Team-Up Abilities In Season Zero
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/marvel-rivals-best-team-up-attacks-season-zero-1851733122

Team-Up Abilities are one of Marvel Rival’s most interesting mechanics is its Team-Up Abilities. Superheroes and villains working together to bring out unique buffs or exclusive moves is a fantastic idea that’s a lot of fun to play with. Although they’re not needed to win matches, each ability adds exciting gameplay additions to the characters. That being said, some are just plain better than others.

Read More: Every Team-Up Attack In Marvel Rivals, Explained

Season Zero’s Team-Up Abilities are incredibly varied and feel notably distinct from one another. That variance just happens to also lead to some differences in effectiveness. Read on for our choices of what the best Marvel Rivals team-up attacks are in the game’s premiere season.

Thor can assist a couple of characters with his Thorforce when they’re on his team. Storm will gain access to a lightning attack that can bounce around and hit multiple enemies. Captain America will meanwhile earn an activatable buff state.

Both heroes benefit greatly from the added moves, but Captain America sees the most improvement. Utilizing the buff gives him a movement bonus and an electric AoE (area-of-effect) buff for his shield throw. These can make him a menace for leading a charge or picking off enemies from the sides.

If you’ve played Overwatch and are a fan of Tracer’s Recall ability, you’ll love Magik’s Team-Up. She provides a similar rewind technique to both Black Panther and Psylocke that returns them to the position they were in five seconds earlier. If they took any damage within that period, they’ll receive some partially healed health too. Overall, this ability is a great tool to increase their survival chances.

Psylocke arguably gets the better end of the bargain here as she’s slower than Black Panther and has 100 less health. Although her Psi-Blade Dash and Psychic Stealth can lead to a quick exit, she’s still in danger within big open areas. Magik’s Dimensional Shortcut provides a new way to escape sticky situations and maybe get some health back too.

Luna Snow is a fun character to use, but you’re going to need good aim as her kit mostly revolves around healing and damaging projectile attacks. Only her Ultimate move has an AoE cast to it. Iron Fist can make up for this drawback with his Atlas Bond Team-Up.

Read More: Earning ‘SVP’ In Marvel Rivals Is A Pretty Sweet Way To Lose

This ability will give Luna an AoE spell that will heal those around her with a burst of health. It will also knock enemies back with a little bit of damage while inflicting a slowing effect for two seconds. Whether you’re using it to heal multiple teammates, aid in an escape, or pin down some enemies for some eliminations, this is one of the most versatile Team-Up Abilities so far. Using it can make that MVP or SVP title a lot more attainable for a healer like Luna.

Groot is a fun tanky character on his own, but for some of us it’s hard to imagine him without also thinking of a furry raccoon creature riding on his shoulder with a giant gun. The Planet X Pals Team-Up brings that imagery to life by allowing either Rocket Raccoon or Jeff The Land Shark to attach onto Groot’s shoulder. They can then attack from the position while enjoying a damage reduction.

Out of all the Team-Ups, this one lends itself to feeling the most symbiotic. Groot can help his smaller friends charge into battle more easily, with both picking off enemies as they go. At the same time, Groot’s passengers can provide easy heals straight from his shoulder. I highly encourage jumping onto your next tree man teammate if you want a more active role during combat.

Some heroes can be a part of multiple Team-Ups. Luna Snow can provide both Jeff the Land Shark and Namor with icy versions of an existing ability. The former temporarily modifies his Aqua Burst to slow enemies, while the latter gets a Frozen Spawn that can slow enemies.

Slowing down your targets is always a fantastic option given how hectic Marvel Rivals matches can get. Both characters play better with these additions, but Namor might edge out for some cooler applications. Just like his regular Monstro Spawn, his Frozen Spawn can also be enhanced. Giving him turrets that slow down enemies and can briefly increase their firing rate is a game-changer.

A Team-Up between two sniper characters is a deadly alliance. When on a team together, Hawkeye gifts Black Widow with a slightly neutered version of his Hunter’s Sight ultimate. She’ll see afterimages generated for eight seconds and can deal damage through them.

The only drawback here is that any Afterimage damage through this ability won’t deal critical hits. It’s a favorable trade-off whether you’re a great sniper or a less-skilled one like me.

Adam Warlock has a one-of-a-kind passive ability with his Regenerative Cocoon. It allows him to move his soul around after dying to choose a place to respawn directly to. His Guardian Revival Team-Up allows him to share this ability with both Mantis and Star-Lord.

Having a self-revive is an incredibly useful option to help you return to the fight quicker. Like Adam Warlock’s version, the one caveat is that everyone can see you in soul form. Try to be discreet with where you return to so you’re not immediately eliminated again.

Ammo Overload was a huge threat in the betas and it remains so after the official launch. When Rocket Raccoon is on the same team as The Punisher and/or Winter Soldier, he can throw out a device that buffs the latter two with a faster firing rate and infinite ammo. This dramatic change in damage output can make getting an Ace kill a lot easier.

Both The Punisher and Winter Soldier dish out decent damage already, but this Team-Up Ability is akin to activating cheat codes. The device’s range is also decent enough that there are always options on where to place it. If these characters are on the same team, this ability needs to be used.

Keeping these top abilities in mind will go a long way during the remainder of Marvel Rivals‘ Season Zero. Recognizing that your enemies have them or that your team could have one if you switch characters is great knowledge to have. Play smart, have fun, and watch out for those Iron Fists.
